posts.name: eithan kalo
posts.cooked: i herd that python will become an official part of WPILIB to the 2024 season and i wanted to know if it will truly become official and if so when will the decomentaician come out

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Yes, that’s the plan.  For now, use the RobotPy documentation .

posts.name: kylelanman
posts.cooked:
Is Python for sure going to be a supported language in 2024?  The blog post announcement indicated that was the goal but said it would happen when it is ready.  Is it ready?

We are getting ready for fall programming training and are wanting to settle in on a language.

posts.name: Tyler Veness
posts.cooked:
kylelanman:

Is Python for sure going to be a supported language in 2024?

Yes. https://www.firstinspires.org/robotics/ frc /blog/2023-first-kitbot-details says there will be Python example code for the KitBot.

Basic code to operate the KitBot as designed in LabVIEW, Java, C++, and Python.

posts.name: kylelanman
posts.cooked:
Great!

Will there be wrappers for Phoenix 5, 6, and/or Pro?

More generically are vendors supposed to supply wrappers/libs or is the WPILib team planning to continue to fulfill that need?

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
